item.title: Bin bags piling up outside tattoo parlour on Nuxley Road, 28th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Nuxley Road, Lessness Heath, London

item.title: Continued disturbance, 28th June
item.description:
Again before 5am this morning. Neighbours complaining of the noise coming in the Allotments. This is happening 2-3 times a week currently. Banging and crashing of the locks and gates. Number plate will be provided on request.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 297, Old Farm Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yet another large Flytip, 28th June
item.description:
There has been another large Flytip last night not 12 feet from the one that was partially blocking the entrance last week to the Weir Hall Avenue cul de sac in N18. This one is on the grass to the right of the entrance and was made yesterday just before midnight by what looked like a dark coloured van. Instead of just clearing these up at the Enfield residents expense, when are the council going to investigate these matters? As I stated last week, surely in these days of doorbell and CCTV cameras you could get some kind of evidence for a prosecution??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Weir Hall Avenue, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture Blocking Pavement, 28th June
item.description:
A occupant if number 1 West Heath Road is emptying out his garage. He is placing furniture on the pavement ready for collection. The van has not appeared. Furniture left on pavement overnight. He was spoken to whilst moving the items. Should have waited until the van arrived.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Amberley Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bayford Street Drowning in Rubbish! Where Are the Enforcers?‚Äù, 28th June
item.description:
161 Mare Street is turning Bayford Street into a filthy wasteland. This brazen, illegal dumping must end now. They are treating this street like a toilet! Hackney Council needs to put an end to this fly-tipping plague!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 28th June
item.description:
